intro: Moquilea espinae, commonly known as the Espina de Moquilea, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Baja California, Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has spiny, woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves adapted to conserve water. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Moquilea espinae is well-suited to harsh, dry environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
